title: LOL is suffering  the Yu-Gi-Oh TCG syndrome
body:
This is an old Overpowered card

https://www.deckboosters.com/image/cache//catalog/deckboosters/products/yugioh-single-cards/gld1-yugioh-cards/GLD1-EN003-yugioh-card-585x585.jpg

A simple effect but overpowered for the time.

This is a NORMAL card nowadays 

https://pm1.narvii.com/6246/c39512f7e40b5afb9e7f54637bfa62dcbe1e871a_hq.jpg


Do you see the similarity with LOL? 
Champions used to be simpler and straightforward.
 {{champion:11}}  got a simple kit focused on mobility and damage.
{{champion:99}}  got a kit for CC and Damage

New champs/ reworks ({{champion:266}}, {{champion:555}} , {{champion:142}} ) now have in their kits, mobility, damage, soft CC, hard CC, range abilities, life regen, etc.

Riot is replacing strategy for over the edge overpowered champs,  only to have little peaks of profit.  

At this rate maybe lol will have the same fate as Yugioh, a game played only by a few who try to remember their glory days.

Tbh, I'd rather fight Yasuo and Irelia than Garen and Tryn any day.

Though, I do enjoy simpler champs with good skill expression like Lux, Poppy and Cait.

People complained about champions being simple and samey so now they stepped things up.

Power creep, happens in all games that constantly evolve, MTG, Hearthstone, PoE, if the game is constantly updating people want and expect better.

Mtg is the opposite of power creep in some ways. Literally spells back in the day and lands were just overpowered (minus creature spells), so much so that most decks in legacy decks need only one land, maybe two then just win. Modern is basically just that, just a little more land reliant. So no, mtg was NOT powercreeped. Sure creature spells have gotten more insane, but nothing compares to some of the most ridiculous instants, and lands back in the day.

Look at a card called ponder, then compare that to some of the other more modern type of cards printed. Force of Will? Insane card! Brainstorm.

Well the complexity creep is kinda natural,because you can't do that much with simple abilities.

People want new champs to feel and play differently,so they can't just release more champs whose strategy is just "run up to the enemy and hit them with autoattacks" like {{champion:11}},they need to differentiate them in meaningful ways.


Not to mention that simple kits often lack counterplay as well,you can't really dodge most of Yis attacks,but you can dodge most of Yasuos or Irelias.

I'll be honest, I don't think it would be that bad if they completely stopped making new champs and focused on updates. I know they want to release new champs so the game doesn't get stale, but isn't that what the updates are for as well?

Riots biggest strengh is champion design (Art, Story, Music, etc.). To stop making new champs would instakill the game. LoL has no varity in game modes: TTL 3v3 is just a small version of SR 5v5 and ARAM is only played by people how dont care anymore or who just want a break from toxicity form normals (sadly you can escape toxicity not even ARAM). The champion releases really are the only thing that make the game feel new and fresh. Without out them it is they same sh!t over and over again. Since RR Riot even struggles to get the game balance to the semi- balance stat we had in the seasons before.
thats the point rito need new modes and bring back dominion, so they dont get stale and dont be soo dependent on new champs

I agree. New modes would indeed give the game more variety. I think Riot just doesnt feel comfortable in creating new game mode. Dominion was Riots first attemp to create something completly diffrent from the main game but they didnt supported it enough and left it in the dust. If they create a champions kit they think about how it performs in SR: they build champs around SR. This make it alot hard to make new game modes which are to diffrent form the main game.

A card being overloaded with a bunch of effects (Ex. Pendulums) does not exactly make it stronger than every other card in the game. Even simple cards like Imperial Order would be potentially stronger.

Then again, Imperial Order makes every deck impossible to run since most decks run on Spell Cards.

Edit: I should've used Solemn Judgement as a better example since its more infamous and a cheaper negation tool in general
